abstract.text: The search for events containing isolated leptons (electrons or muons) and missing transverse momentum produced in e ± p collisions is performed individually and in a common phase space with the H1 and ZEUS detectors at HERA in the period 1994-2007.
The analysed H1+ZEUS data sample corresponds to an integrated luminosity of 0.97 fb −1 , and composes of the complete high energy data from the HERA programme.
A total of 87 events are observed in the data, compared to a Standard Model (SM) prediction of 92.7 ± 11.2.
At large hadronic transverse momentum P X T > 25 GeV in the e + p data, luminosity 0.58 fb −1 , 23 data events are observed compared to a SM prediction of 14.6 ± 1.9.

Production cross section measurements of events containing isolated leptons and missing transverse momentum and single W production, as well as W polarisation fractions performed by the H1 Collaboration are also presented.
The H1 isolated lepton events are also examined in the context of a search for single top production.

body_text.text: Introduction
Events containing a high P T isolated electron or muon and associated with missing transverse momentum have been observed at HERA [1,2,3,4].
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: An excess of HERA I data events (1994-2000, mostly in e + p collisions) compared to the SM prediction at large hadronic transverse momentum P X T was reported by the H1 Collaboration [2], which was not confirmed by the ZEUS Collaboration, although the analysis was performed in a more restricted phase space [4].
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: The main SM contribution to the signal topology is the production of real W bosons via photoproduction with subsequent leptonic decay ep → eW ± (→ lν)X, where the hadronic system X is typically of low P T .
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: The equivalent charged current process ep → νW ± (→ lν)X also contributes to the total signal rate, although only at a level of around 7%.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: The production of Z 0 bosons with subsequent decay to neutrinos ep → eZ 0 (→ νν)X results in a further minor contribution 1 to the total signal rate in the electron channel at a level of 3%.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: The event selection employed by the H1 [5] and ZEUS [6] analyses are very similar and may be summarised as follows: The identified lepton should have high transverse momentum P l T > 10 GeV, be observed in the central region of the detector and be isolated with respect to jets and other tracks in the event.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: The event should also contain a large transverse momentum imbalance, P miss T > 12 GeV.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: Further cuts are then applied, which are designed to reduce SM background, whilst preserving a high level of signal purity.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: Event quantities sensitive to the presence of high energy undetected particles in the event are employed such as the azimuthal balance of the event, the difference in azimuthal angle between the lepton and the hadronic system and the longitudinal momentum imbalance.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: To ensure that the two lepton channels are exclusive and may therefore be combined, electron events must contain no isolated muons.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: Results from the H1 and ZEUS Analyses

Both H1 and ZEUS have recently performed the analysis of the electron and muon channels 2 on their respective complete HERA I+II data sets, which correspond to approximately 0.5 fb −1 per experiment [5,6].
body_text.section: Results from the H1 and ZEUS Analyses

body_text.text: A total of 59 events are observed in the H1 data, compared to a SM prediction of 58.9 ± 8.2.
body_text.section: Results from the H1 and ZEUS Analyses

body_text.text: For P X T > 25 GeV, a total of 24 events are observed compared to a SM prediction of 15.8 ± 2.5, where 21 events are observed in the e + p data compared to a SM prediction of 8.9 ± 1.5.

body_text.text: A Combined H1 and ZEUS Analysis

A study of the selection efficiency for signal process using the event generator EPVEC [8] found the H1 and ZEUS analyses to be compatible in the kinematic region where they are directly comparable [9, 10].
body_text.section: A Combined H1 and ZEUS Analysis

body_text.text: The majority of the data events observed by H1 at P X T > 25 GeV are also found to fall into the region of overlap of the two analyses.
body_text.section: A Combined H1 and ZEUS Analysis

body_text.text: Nevertheless, in order to coherently combine the results from the two experiments, a common phase space has been established.
body_text.section: A Combined H1 and ZEUS Analysis

body_text.text: The common selection is based on the H1 event selection [2,5], but over a more restricted lepton polar angle range of 15 • < θ l < 120 • , as employed in the ZEUS analysis [6].
body_text.section: A Combined H1 and ZEUS Analysis

body_text.text: The signal expectation rates of the H1 and ZEUS analyses using the common selection are found to be comparable, taking into account the respective luminosities of the data sets and the signal processes included.

body_text.text: More details on the combination of the H1 and ZEUS analyses can be found in [11].

body_text.text: Search for Single Top Quark Production
A search for single top quark production at HERA is performed by H1 as an extension of the search for isolated lepton events, using the full HERA I+II e ± p data [13,14].
body_text.section: Search for Single Top Quark Production

body_text.text: The investigated model considers anomalous production of top quarks in a Flavour Changing Neutral Current process involving the coupling κ tuγ .
body_text.section: Search for Single Top Quark Production

body_text.text: A multivariate analysis is performed to discriminate top from SM background (dominated by real W production).
body_text.section: Search for Single Top Quark Production

body_text.text: No evidence for single top production is observed.
body_text.section: Search for Single Top Quark Production

body_text.text: An upper limit on the anomalous top production cross section of σ ep→etX < 0.16 pb is established at 95% CL.
body_text.section: Search for Single Top Quark Production

body_text.text: The corresponding H1 limit on the coupling κ tuγ < 0.14 is shown in figure 2 (right) and is currently the best limit compared to those from other colliders 3 .
